concepts.term: medical imaging is a technical field
if you understand how imaging systems work
you can apply that knowledge to real-world problems
biomedical engineering is a great profession
it sits at the intersection of life sciences, medicine, and engineering

evidence: medical imaging is a technical field, but it's also full of opportunities.
if you understand how imaging systems work, and you can apply that knowledge to real-world problems, you'll bring serious value to any team-whether in research, healthcare, or industry.
biomedical engineering is a great profession.
it sits at the intersection of life sciences, medicine, and engineering-and that makes it both exciting and employable.
